# Random Signatures

Random signatures allow a user to generate file signatures that change from executions.
The blocksize and file signatures as well as block or block group signatures can all be randomized.
This strengthens a signature by make it more difficult for an attacker to predict which signatures will be used or
to spoof signatures.  


# Signature randomization

This is a brief list of attributes that can be randomized.

- Signature file list
- Signature block group list 
- Signature block list
- Signature file block size
- File block Modulus bit size
- Signature format

## How to Use

Mdencode and the signature generator utilizes a binary hash list for files and blocks. Implementing a random signature involves randomizing the
binary string. It could also randomize a csv signature list.

These are some examples

```
ghost@test:~/projects/src/github.com/singularian/mdencode/code/mdencode$ md -file=test -all

This example shows a block randomization and a file hash list randomization as well as a set block hash list binary parameter

```
ghost@excelsior:~/projects/src/github.com/singularian/mdencode/code/mdencode$ md -file=Makefile -blockr -bh=11 -fr
